intro: Gochnatia sordida, commonly known as the black gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is typically shrub-like, with hairy stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, which are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Gochnatia sordida is adapted to dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
